Are you highly motivated by being able to make a difference in improving patients’ lives? Are you an efficient executive who is energized by taking exceptions and able to influence people around you? If so, you should continue reading and apply today!The Region Asia Pacific (APAC) Senior Manager Clinical Quality, Training role provides you the opportunity to work in an efficient team and contribute directly towards the business results while creating values for the patients with diabetes, obesity, and other serious chronic and rare diseases.
 About the department
Novo Nordisk (NN) is a global healthcare company with 100 years of innovation and supervision in diabetes care. This heritage has given us experience and capabilities that also enable us to help people defeat obesity, haemophilia, growth disorders, rare diseases, and other serious chronic diseases. Headquartered in Denmark, Novo Nordisk employs over 60,000 people in 80 countries and markets its products in more than 170 countries.The position
As the Region APAC Senior Manager, Clinical Quality & Training, you will regularly perform risk assessment, develop risk mitigation activities and coordinate the quality, training and education activities for Clinical Operations teams together with clinical quality and training teams located in India, Thailand, Australia and South Korea. This position aids high quality and solid compliance with International Conference on Harmonization (ICH) Good clinical practice (GCP), and relevant regulation Novo Nordisk (NN) internal Standard operating procedures (SOPs). The position should have substantial knowledge of international clinical trial methodology as well as execution/conduct. The position will provide quality status to management as needed in Global councils and forums.This position will be operating from one of the locations- Bangalore, India or Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia and will report to the Region APAC Clinical Operations Director based in Dubai.You will plan, coordinate, and manage GCP Inspection Readiness activities across APAC for Health Authorities (HA) inspections e.g., Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or European Medicines Evaluation Agency (EMA) and acts as the chair in major foreign HA inspections in APAC countries. Work closely and coordinate/lead APAC CQTM group of 10 people. 
Maintain Clinical Quality Management system (QMS) in APAC in line with the Novo Nordisk Global Clinical QMS .
You will plan, coordinate, and perform GCP compliance visits to ensure high level of compliance to ICH-GCP, NN SOPs and all relevant local requirement. 
You will represent APAC in global and other international forums.
Identify clinical training needs in APAC countries and prepare yearly training plan and keep up to date accordingly. Develop and maintain training modules for new hires of different roles. QualificationsDegree or higher qualifications in Pharmacy, Life Sciences or other related field.
At least 7-10 years of experience in the conduct of clinical trials and 3 years in clinical quality & training areas. Preferably certified as a lead auditor.
Experienced in GCP (Good clinical practices) Audits & Inspections. 
Worked or experience in clinical quality/GCP quality/GCP compliance/GCP quality oversight/clinical compliance/ clinical quality oversight/clinical operational excellence/clinical excellence areas.
Require clinical trials operational experience in roles such as CRA, clinical trial project manager, clinical research manager or clinical trials manager. The candidate is expected to have leadership/line manager experience.
